author: Brian Turner
method: Heat the oil and butter in a pan and gently fry the onion and garlic until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to a gentle simmer. Add the cream and the watercress, stir well and bring to a simmer. Allow to cool slightly, then blend with a hand-blender until smooth. To serve, place the chopped bacon into a pan and fry until crisp. Pour the soup into a shallow serving bowl. Garnish with a dollop of yoghurt and sprinkle over the bacon.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  25g/1oz butter,  ½ onion, finely chopped,  1 garlic clove, finely chopped,  300ml/10fl oz vegetable stock,  50ml/2fl oz double cream,  75g/2¾oz watercress,  1 rasher smoked bacon, chopped,  1 tbsp Greek-style yoghurt
